## Load Libraries

library(tidyverse)

```

```
## Demo Data
Use built in R datasets, esoph. Data from a case-control study of esophageal cancer in Ille-et-Vilaine, France
Is a data frame with records of 88 individuals with their alcohol and tobacco status, and how many cases of noncases in each combination category
```{r summary(esoph), echo=TRUE}
summary(esoph)
```
## Demo Question
Which age group has the highest number of cases under alcohol consumption?

### Base R code example 
```{r echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
case_df1a <- esoph[c("agegp","alcgp","ncases")]  #select variables 
case_df1b <- case_df1a[order(case_df1a$ncases, decreasing = TRUE),] #reorder in decreasing
kable(head(case_df1b))
```

### Tidyverse R code example 
```{r echo=TRUE}
case_df2 <- esoph  %>% select(c(agegp,alcgp,ncases)) %>% arrange(desc(ncases)) 
kable(head(case_df2))
```

## Demo Plot
The number of cases in each Alcohol Consumption group by ages 
```{r esoph, echo=TRUE}
ggplot(case_df2,aes(x=alcgp, y=ncases, fill=agegp)) +
        geom_bar(position="dodge", stat="identity") +
        xlab("Alcohol Consumption (g/day)") + ylab("Number of Cases") +
        labs(fill = "Age Group")
```
